problem.tex: Is there a sequence of polynomials which converge uniformly to the function $\frac{1}{z}$ on the annulus $1<|z|<2$?

solution.tex: No. Let $G$ be the annulus $1<|z|<2$. Suppose $f:G\to\mathbb{C}$ is analytic and $p_n\to f$ uniformly on $G$. Let $c$ be once around the circle $|z|=\frac{3}{2}$. Because $p_n$ are entire functions for all $n$, by the Cauchy integral theorem \[\int_cp_ndz=0.\] Then, by uniform convergence, \[\lim\int_cp_ndz=\int_c\lim p_ndz=\int_cfdz=0.\] Thus $f(z)\neq\frac{1}{z}$ because \[\int_c\frac{1}{z}dz=2\pi i\neq0.\]
